results.title: Starting up, moving off and stopping
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “How to Drive”.
Safe driving techniques begin even before the engine is started. Demonstrates good habits to acquire on entering the car: checking the driving position, the seat belt and all-round visibility. The procedures involved in starting, moving off and stopping are shown; confidence and ability can now be gained by practice.

results.title: Spotlight on Australian Ballet
results.creator_credit: Doc K Sternberg, Geoff Powell, Loch Townsend, A Anderson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A survey of the development of ballet in Australia. The contribution made by such enthusiasts as Edouard Borovansky, Helene Kirsova, Laurel Martyn, Dorothy Stevenson, and other Australian dancers in training and encouraging aspiring dancers, and the untiring efforts of the various corps des ballets, the majority of whom have had to fit in their clases and training, and in many cases, their actual performances, after normal working hours, are presented as the background to the status of ballet in Australia in 1948. Narrated by John Bushelle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Doc K Sternberg, Geoff Powell, Loch Townsend, A Anderson and Australian National Film Board

results.title: The Splendour and the Peaks
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Eric Thompson, Tasmanian Government Film Unit, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The Freycinet and Mount Field National Parks in Tasmania. Family parties and bushwalkers visit the Freycinet Peninsular where the red granite peaks of the Hazards dominate the sheltered waters of Coles Bay. From the summit of the highest peak, Mt Amos, there is a magnificent view of Wineglass Bay. At Mt Field we find the Russell Falls, Lake Dobson, Lake Seal, the towering dolerite columns of the watcher, and beautiful trees, birds and mosses to delight the visitor.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Rogers, Eric Thompson, Tasmanian Government Film Unit, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Around Australia. No. 1. South-west corner
results.creator_credit: Dennis Hill Productions and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Two hundred miles south of the Western Australian capital of Perth stands Cape Leeuwin Lighthouse. We see something of the life of farmers in the district who run beef and dairy cattle nearby, whilst for the visiting tourists there is fishing, birdwatching, and exploration of the limestone caves.

results.title: Soccer
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Man and His Sport”.
Looks at soccer in Australia, concentrating mainly on the coaching of young players to learn the game. Also shows Australia’s international team in action.

results.title: Snowy waters
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, John Martin-Jones and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A brief description of the large-scale hydroelectric schemes being undertaken by the Snowy Mountains Hydro-electric Authority. When completed the scheme will change the geography of an area as large as Switzerland by completely altering the course of streams and rivers. The film shows some of the work undertaken by the scheme including the construction of dams, building of roads and extensive excavations.

results.title: Skidding
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”.
Every driver should aim to drive and control their vehicle so that skidding never occurs. A skid ocurs when any of the three forces acting upon a car in motion - acceleration, braking, steering - is increased sufficiently to overcome the grip of the tyres on the road. Rear wheel, front wheel and four-wheel skids are shown and the right corrective action for each one. Also the types of road surfaces which tend to produce skidding.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Sister, if you only knew
results.creator_credit: Janet Isaac, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The theme of this film is about the pressures on Aboriginal women living in the city…what effect it has also on their men and their children. The film focuses on four women and the part they played in the movement demanding more equal opportunities for urban Aboriginals, for better conditions, the removal of discriminatory Acts, etc. Although life is difficult the women seem to survive better than the men. Their humour, intelligence and resilience in the face of life’s difficulties often surprise people who see this film. The women are Leila Rankine (Music and Tribal Culture Education), Ruby Hammond (Legail Aid), Mary Williams (Aboriginal Kindergarten) and Gladys Elphick, MBE (President, Aboriginal Women’s Council).

results.title: The Mystery single vehicle crash
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”
Although many drivers involved in single vehicle crashes attribute the cause of their accidents to mechanical failures of the car, very often it was the driver and not the car who was to blame. This film stresses that while mechanical checks of one’s car are most important, it is even more vital that the driver is in good physical and mental condition before taking to the road.
